content.rendered:
Photo via Gratisography

Are you ready for the Growvember Genesis community challenge? Plus, a gorgeous, new WooCommerce compatible Genesis theme from StudioPress, and Carrie Dils chats with WP Engine founder, Jason Cohen.

Themes

StudioPress launch a new WooCommerce compatible Genesis theme, Infinity Pro (Demo).

Introducing Infinity Pro, a @WooCommerce-compatible theme by @bgardner — https://t.co/WpWHj3LMjB #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Gh5Wmtt00h

— StudioPress (@studiopress) November 9, 2016

Chinmoy Paul continues to develop his Beaver Builder focused Genesis theme, GBEAVER.

Added new Home page layout in #genesiswp + @BeaverBuilder "GBeaver" child theme https://t.co/WWb5cPBh32 pic.twitter.com/UOZJf2kVpL

— Beaver World (@wpbeaverworld) November 9, 2016

Transparent Header with Hero Banner – https://t.co/8kAQutqJUR #genesiswp #herobanner #header #heroimage

— Beaver World (@wpbeaverworld) November 7, 2016

And Calvin Koepke’s latest theme is coming along too.

Changed the design of my upcoming free #genesiswp theme and diggin' it.

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) November 10, 2016

Showcase

It’s only been out a few days, but CottamPress have already shared a good example of Infinity Pro out in the wild at cottampress.com

so @studiopress have excelled again with the Infinity Pro #GenesisWP child theme. Beautiful. I'm running it at https://t.co/JIG8wk6fUV

— CottamPress (@cottampress) November 9, 2016

Gary Jones, launches danielsagmarketing.com, in collaboration with Craig Simpson and Alain Schlesser.

Last week we launched https://t.co/4QofplZaLe with design, logo and theme from @craigsimps, and custom plugins from @GaryJ and @schlessera.

— Gamajo Tech (@Gamajo) November 6, 2016

Plus, two other sites from Gary you might’ve missed, gainfutures.com and futuresonline.com

In May & Sept, we launched https://t.co/e17jmZD98Q & https://t.co/9Cpa9UCjBp, both converted from ColdFusion into WP sites.

— Gamajo Tech (@Gamajo) November 6, 2016

Matt Whiteley (with desigb by MOSS KREATIV) for teamsterslocal638.org

Another recent #genesiswp launch: https://t.co/DBMhbbwRX3. Beautiful design from @MOSSKREATIV. Full portfolio – https://t.co/yAe0zvYLBa

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) November 7, 2016

Krista Delisa relaunches her own site, designbykrista.co

Check out my latest work >> Design By Krista Branding + WordPress Website https://t.co/D4nvVfrIFz #wordpress #genesiswp #website #business pic.twitter.com/J8az101CgF

— Krista DeLisle (@kristadelisle) November 12, 2016

MysteryLabTV with a new site on the Focus Pro with some interesting subject matter at mysterylabtv.com

Our new website is live! Matthew and I built the new site using a great #genesiswp theme. Check out the new site https://t.co/DIef9VxmVe pic.twitter.com/nFR1NbW1zw

— MysteryLabTV (@MysteryLabTV) November 7, 2016

Crystal O’Connell with a new site at ra.ca

So excited about my new website launch – Real Alternatives for Out Living the Dream! Check it out: https://t.co/BDG2xIXYSo #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/a4XDT28Vm1

— Crystal OConnell (@Crystal_OC) November 9, 2016

Podcasts

On StudioPress.fm, Brian and Lauren chat to Jason Schuller on Press75 and living the dream as a creative entrepreneur.

New Episode! The Creative Entrepreneur: Living the Dream — https://t.co/bL9AadoJn7 with @jschuller pic.twitter.com/mgj4iBQSeJ

— StudioPress (@studiopress) November 10, 2016

While over on OfficeHours.fm, Carrie Dils chats to Jason Cohen, founder of WP Engine.

Episode 118 – Startups and Entrepreneurship with Jason Cohen of @wpengine now available for your listening pleasure https://t.co/2ohlSnxSlD

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) November 8, 2016

Best of the rest

Neil Gee on adding an offscreen content area with a toggle to a Genesis theme.

Adding an offscreen content area with a toggle to a #GenesisWP Theme https://t.co/KFpkvamSo0

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) November 12, 2016

Sridhar Katakam with a handy tutorial on displaying CPT taxonomy terms in Genesis entry footer.

Displaying CPT taxonomy terms in Genesis entry footer:https://t.co/eSqrRaaw1e#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/CWAsp0udFP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) November 12, 2016

Nice interview with Matt Ryan on the GoDaddy blog on using Genesis (h/t Sal Ferrarello).

Great article about @MattRy from the WordPress @burbswp Meetup and a #genesiswp developer. https://t.co/BhfGx91iE9

— Sal Ferrarello (@salcode) November 10, 2016

WP Clips has a new Genesis ‘Clip’ coming soon.

The #GenesisWP Clip is nearly here. The smallest and safest Clip available, specifically designed for Genesis users. pic.twitter.com/A65Fn1687a

— WP Clips (@WP_Clips) November 8, 2016

And finally…

If you’re not already a part of it, check out the Growvember challenged going on in the business channel of the Genesis Slack community right now, where members are challenging each other to spend an hour each day working on your business to help it grow.

For those in the #genesiswp Slack community, we started a #Growvember challenge in the business channel. pic.twitter.com/zdXhZxEBuH

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) November 6, 2016

—

That’s all for this week I’ll be back soon with more Genesis goodness for you all.

Till then, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

PS New to This Week in Genesis? Why not subscribe below and never miss an edition. You’ll get one, very occasionally two, emails a week just on the finest things happening in our community.

PPS Want to let me know about something awesome you’re doing in the Genesis community? Go add it to the site now! It’s free, easy and it’s a great way to get what you’re doing in front of more people.

excerpt.rendered: Are you ready for the Growvember Genesis community challenge? Plus, a new WooCommerce compatible theme from StudioPress, and Carrie Dils chats with Jason Cohen of WP Engine.
